symptoms.name: Joint pain
symptoms.severity: Variable, can range from mild to severe (10/10)
symptoms.pattern: Oligoarticular (most frequent), monoarticular;  knee most frequent site, also ankles, fingers, wrist, hip

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be low-grade or absent
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.severity: Variable, may be absent even in cases of purpura fulminans
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present; purpura fulminans can occur as a severe complication

symptoms.name: Edema
symptoms.pattern: May be present in affected extremity, especially in severe cases

symptoms.name: Purpura
symptoms.pattern: Can occur as a complication, particularly purpura fulminans

vital_signs.temperature: Variable, can be normal, low-grade fever (37.5°C), or absent
vital_signs.heart_rate: Variable, tachycardia (120-138 bpm) may be present

physical_findings: Limited active movement of affected joints
Warmth and tenderness to palpation in affected joints

lab_values.white_blood_cell_count: Variable, can be normal or elevated;  joint fluid WBC can range from 8.7 x 10^3 cells/µL to >1500 cells/mm3

risk_factors: Low socioeconomic class (for septic arthritis in general, not specifically meningococcal)

imaging_findings.ultrasound: May show synovitis and joint effusion

required: Proven meningococcal disease (N. meningitidis identified in blood, CSF, or synovial fluid)
supportive: Elevated WBC count (peripheral or joint fluid)
Positive synovial fluid culture for N. meningitidis (for septic arthritis)
